com.aplpi.wapreview
Class WmlDeck

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.aplpi.wapreview.WmlDeck
All Implemented Interfaces:
WmlDeckInterface
public class WmlDeck
extends java.lang.Object
implements WmlDeckInterface

see http://wapreview.sourceforge.net Copyright (C) 2000 Robert Fuller, Applepie Solutions Ltd. This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA This class represents a WmlDeck containing WmlCards. The deck is constructed by the WmlDeckBuilder, based upon the content of a WML deck retrieved from a URL. The deck contains all the cards within the WML deck, and provides common resources which include:

See Also:
WmlDeckBuilder

ontimer

public java.lang.String ontimer()
Returns the javascript representation of the ontimer event for this deck. This method is invoked by cards which do not have their own ontimer event specified.

getCard

public WmlCard getCard(java.lang.String cardName)
Returns the named card. If the named card cannot be found, a new card indicating this situation is constructed and returned.
Parameters:
cardName - The name of the wanted card.

addCard

public void addCard(java.lang.Object card)
Add the specified card onto this Deck. An explicit typecast is to convert the card from an Object into a WmlCard in order to avoid circular dependencies between WmlCardInterface and WmlDeckInterface. This method simply invokes the addCard(WmlCard card) method after performing the typecast. This method may be invoked by the WmlDeckBuilder during construction of this deck.
Specified by:
addCard in interface WmlDeckInterface
Parameters:
card - The card to be added to the deck.

addCard

public void addCard(WmlCard card)
Add the specified card onto this Deck. This method may be invoked by the WmlDeckBuilder during construction of this deck.
Parameters:
card - The card to be added to the deck.

newTask

public WmlTask newTask()
Create and return a new WmlTask belonging to this Deck. This method may be invoked by WmlDeckBuilder during construction of this deck. The new deck is pushed onto a stack of tasks held to the deck and also onto a stack of task which are currently open during parsing.
See Also:
WmlTask

endTask

public void endTask()
Removes a task from a stack of tasks which are open during parsing of the WML content. This method is invoked by WmlDeckBuilder during construction of the deck.

getTask

public WmlTask getTask(int index)
Returns the WmlTask at the specified index.
Parameters:
index - The index identifying the wanted task.

currentTask

public WmlTask currentTask()
Returns the current task, if one exists. This method may be invoked by the WmlDeckBuilder during construction of this deck.

getHref

public java.lang.String getHref(int index)
Returns the javascript required to invoke the task at the specified index.
Parameters:
index - The index of the wanted reference.

countTasks

public int countTasks()
Returns a count of the number of tasks belonging to this deck.

resolveUrl

public java.lang.String resolveUrl(java.lang.String url)
Resolves and returns a string representing a url. This method may be invoked by WmlDeckBuilder during construction of this deck in order to resolve any url's contained within the deck.
Specified by:
resolveUrl in interface WmlDeckInterface
Parameters:
url - A string representing the url to be resolved.

dump

public void dump()
Dump all the cards belonging to this deck. The dump() method will be invoked on each card belonging to this deck. This method is useful for debugging purposes.

expandVariables

public java.lang.String expandVariables(java.lang.String s)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Expand any $variables in the string with their corresponding values. Escape modes are parsed but ignored. eg $(var:unesc) == $(var) == $(var:escape) == $(var:noesc)
Specified by:
expandVariables in interface WmlDeckInterface
Parameters:
s - The string which may contain variables
